title: How to Heat Silly Putty

steps.headline: Put a little water down on a flat surface.
Bend the lamp over as close to the surface as possible.
steps.description: (Let oxygen in, make it at least 1 inch away).

steps.headline: Let the lamp sit over the wet-coated surface for about 5 minutes.
Lift up the lamp.
steps.description: The surface doesn't have to be hot, just warm. (Place the lamp back on for extra heating, while you do the next step)

steps.headline: Take your Silly Putty and place it on the surface, out of the heated area.
Flatten it and smooth out any jagged or rough edges and make it nice and smooth.
Lift the lamp, so your hand fits comfortably without getting burned.
Place the Silly Putty on the heated surface.
Place the lamp as far down possible, just make sure it is open enough to monitor the putty.
Let sit underneath the lamp for about 10-15 minutes.
Take out from under the lamp .

text: Put a little water down on a flat surface.  Bend the lamp over as close to the surface as possible. (Let oxygen in, make it at least 1 inch away). Let the lamp sit over the wet-coated surface for about 5 minutes.  Lift up the lamp. The surface doesn't have to be hot, just warm. (Place the lamp back on for extra heating, while you do the next step) Take your Silly Putty and place it on the surface, out of the heated area.  Flatten it and smooth out any jagged or rough edges and make it nice and smooth.  Lift the lamp, so your hand fits comfortably without getting burned.  Place the Silly Putty on the heated surface.  Place the lamp as far down possible, just make sure it is open enough to monitor the putty.  Let sit underneath the lamp for about 10-15 minutes.  Take out from under the lamp .  Play!
